citation.article-title: Salimicrobium flavidum sp. nov., isolated from a marine solar saltern
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salimicrobium flavidum sp. nov.
Salimicrobium flavidum (fla′vi.dum. L. neut. adj. flavidum pale yellow).
Cells are Gram-variable-staining and coccoid-, ovoid- or rod-shaped (0.4–1.3×0.8–9.0 μm).
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Colonies are circular, slightly convex, glistening, smooth and pale yellow, 1.5–2.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 37 °C on MA with 8 % NaCl.
Growth occurs at 4 and 40 °C but not at 45 °C (optimum, 37 °C), at pH 6.0 but not at pH 5.5 (optimum, pH 7.0–8.0), and in the presence of 1.0–26.0 % NaCl (optimum, 10 % NaCl).
Anaerobic growth does not occur on MA with 8 % NaCl with or without nitrate supplementation.
Mg2+ ions are required for growth.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed, but aesculin, casein, gelatin, starch, hypoxanthine, xanthine and l-tyrosine are not.
H2S is not produced.

Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, d-ribose, sucrose and trehalose, but not from l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-galactose, lactose, maltose, melezitose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, myo-inositol, d-sorbitol or d-xylose.

Susceptible to the following antibiotics (μg per disc, unless indicated otherwise): ampicillin (10), carbenicillin (100), cephalothin (30), chloramphenicol (100), kanamycin (30), lincomycin (15), novobiocin (5), oleandomycin (15) and penicillin G (20 U) and weakly susceptible to streptomycin (50), but not to gentamicin (30), neomycin (30), polymyxin B (100 U) or tetracycline (30).

In assays with the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4) and esterase lipase (C8) are present and β-galactosidase is weakly present, but lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α- and β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are absent.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diamino acid.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
Major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 49.3 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, ISL-25T (=KCTC 13260T=CCUG 56755T), was isolated from a marine solar saltern of the Yellow Sea in Korea.
